description: A set of questions to test the software with
name: KCHS Local Pilot

questions.question: 1. Charleston's BASH Phase II Period is:
responses: Implemented by 437 OG/CC (coordinated with 315 OG/CC) and announced by FCIF

questions.question: 2. Crews will obtain the Bird Watch Condition, if available, prior to:
3. The AHAS Bird condition is Moderate, for a Military Training Route:
responses: Crews will fly no faster that 250 knots on affected route segments
Crews will limit their altitude to 1000 AGLon affected route segments
Crews need AW/CC approval to fly affected route segments at night

questions.question: 4. Practice circling approaches are not authorized between:
5. Avoid all downtown Charleston hospital complexes when flying VFR approaches to runway 33 below:
6. Low levels on locally developed, non-FLIP low-level routes are approved at what altitude?
7. When unable to avoid overflights of Santee Wildlife Refuge, fly no lower than:
8. If you are flying IR-035/IR-036 and the IR route will be terminated at North Field:
responses: Be sure to cancel IFR with ATC
Your approach must be an abeam tactical arrival
Entry to North Field's airspace will be no lower than 2000' AGL
There are no exits to these IR routes near North Field so the entire route must be flown

questions.question: 9. If there is an USAF LZSO in the tower at North Field a maximum of ______ aircraft are allowedin the pattern?
responses: One integral formation if traffic pattern deconfliction. landing separation and remarshaling plansare thoroughly briefed between the formation aircrews.

questions.question: 10. Contact Columbia Approach (124.15) if climbing above ______ in the vicinity of North Field.
responses: Columbia Approach really doesn't care if C-17s contact them or not

questions.question: 11. With prior coordination, combat offloads are authorized at North Field?
12. At JB Charleston, it is permissible for a crew to block themselves into or out of parking, withoutwing walkers, while aircraft are parked adjacent to their parking location?
responses: False. Parking at JB Charleston without a marshaller/wing walker is NEVER allowed

questions.question: 13. During reverse taxi operations, do not taxi within _______ of any obstruction.
responses: 25 ft with or without a marshaller/wing walker

questions.question: 14. When looking from the left seat, an imaginary line drawn from the 5 o’clock position of the #1engine cowling approximates 25 feet of wingtip clearance.
responses: FALSE. It is 10 feet of wingtip clearance.
FALSE. There are no engines on the left wing.
FALSE. It is 50 feet of wingtip clearance.

questions.question: 15. If wingtip clearance is ever in doubt, the best course of action is to:
responses: Trust the marshaller, they have the best view
Shut down engines and park in place
Deplane a crew member to verify wingtip clearance
Transfer aircraft control to the pilot on the critical side

questions.question: 16. During backing operations, if the LM says “Stop” or communication is lost:
responses: Bring the throttles to idle reverse for 3-4 seconds before applying brakes
Confirm the command with the LM before stopping
Slowly bring the aircraft to a stop to prevent a hot brake scenario

questions.question: 17. A cross-cockpit 25 foot wingtip clearance reference is:
responses: The large knob on the opposite HUD, if the HUD is in the up position is approximately 25 feet
Conservatively, the opposite side cockpit window knob
Halfway up the opposite clear view window

questions.question: 18. An approximate reference for the outer edge of the main landing gear is:
responses: The top eighth of the window approximates the outboard side of the trucks
There is no way to determine the edge of the main landing gear
From the troop door, the LM can use the MLG door to approximate 3 ft of clearance

questions.question: 19. The painted boxes on the ramp at JB Charleston, provide ______ feet of wingtip clearanceprovided all equipment is completely within the painted lines.
20. IAW AFI 1-401, Combat Support time will be logged while transporting combat troops/suppliesand is determined by the airspace you transit or the distance from hostile regions.

21. VOR/DME/TACAN/GPS Runway 21. In order to prevent noise complaints and damage toMedway Plantation at the Naval Weapons Station, crews are asked to delay descent to FAF altitudeor below 1600’ until established on final and inside:

22. It is imperative that crews on operational missions relay all information of unusual occurrences,aircraft damage, or waiver requests through their squadron operations officer and or stan/eval offices.

23. Maintenance will provide a (an) _______ at every jet at crew show or APEX loading time(whichever is earlier) and should have the aircraft powered up with external power. Maintenance willalso provide an air conditioning/heater unit (if available) when outside air temperature is less than____ or greater than ______.

24. ircrew will start the APU approximately _____ minutes prior to engine start to accomplishSCEFC and FCC hydraulic preflight tests and, after landing, will delay APU start untilapproximately _____ minutes from block in.
